skill.name: Skill Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user wants to "create a skill", "add a skill to plugin", "write a new skill", "improve skill description", "organize skill content", or needs guidance on skill structure, progressive disclosure, or skill development best practices for Claude Code plugins.

skill.author: NOASSERTION

security_audit.summary: Official skill from Anthropic with instructional content only. No executable code or network actions are present in the scanned files.

content.value_statement: Skill creation can be confusing without structure and trigger guidance. This skill provides a step by step process and best practices for Claude Code plugins.
actual_capabilities: Explains required skill structure and SKILL.md metadata rules
Defines progressive disclosure and resource placement guidance
Provides a six step skill creation and iteration process
Lists validation checklist items for quality and triggers
Details plugin specific discovery and testing steps
limitations: Does not generate files or execute scripts
Does not package or zip skills for distribution
Does not verify plugin layout on disk
No automated linting or tests are included

use_cases.title: Create a new skill
use_cases.description: Define structure, triggers, and resources for a new Claude Code plugin skill.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill quality
use_cases.description: Apply consistent validation and writing standards across team skills.

use_cases.title: Improve skill docs
use_cases.description: Refine SKILL.md wording and move detailed content to references.

prompt_templates.title: Plan a simple skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple skill plan for a Claude Code plugin. Include trigger phrases, core steps, and which resources to add.

prompt_templates.title: Refine skill triggers
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite my skill description to include specific user phrases and third person wording. Keep it short and concrete.

prompt_templates.title: Design resource layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose what belongs in SKILL.md versus references, examples, and scripts for a complex skill.

prompt_templates.title: Run validation checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate my skill against the validation checklist and list any gaps to fix.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for plugin onboarding
output: Define clear trigger phrases for onboarding tasks
Keep SKILL.md short with core steps and links to references
Add references for policies and examples for common setups
Validate structure and writing style before testing

best_practices: Use specific trigger phrases in third person description
Keep SKILL.md lean and move details to references
Validate structure and examples before testing
anti_patterns: Write in second person or vague language
Place all details in SKILL.md without references
Reference files that do not exist

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code plugins?
faq.answer: Yes. It is written for Claude Code plugin skill directories and discovery rules.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not create files, run scripts, or package skills.

faq.question: How does it integrate with my plugin?
faq.answer: Follow the directory structure under skills and add SKILL.md with required metadata.

faq.question: Does it handle data safety or privacy?
faq.answer: It does not process user data. It only provides documentation guidance.

faq.question: What if my skill does not trigger?
faq.answer: Strengthen the description with exact user phrases and verify the skill directory path.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic skill guides?
faq.answer: It is tailored for Claude Code plugin workflows and discovery behavior.
